fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Apple’s Siri does not have only a female voice, as we said in an editorial about computer assistants; a male variation is available. Also, the article implied that the computer scientist Grace Hopper coined the term “bug” for a computer-related problem. That overlooked Thomas Edison’s use of the term in relation to technical problems in the 1800s, though Hopper is said to have popularised its use in the 1940s (The female voices that computers use to talk to us reveal real-world prejudice, 25 June, page 2, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Scotland ‘at risk of losing environmental protection after Brexit’ IVF study finds success rate lower in men over 51 than under 35 Foreign Office overseas staffing cut by 1,000 in 30 years, say diplomats
